p.em: If a motor nerve is cut, which of the following would happen?

multiple_choice.choice: The muscle controlled by that particular nerve will not contract.
The bone the muscle is attached to will not move.
Certain motor reflexes may no longer function.

response.feedback: Correct. Motor nerves control all of these things.
This is not the best answer. It's true that the muscle will not be able to contract, but what else will this lead to?
This is not the best answer. It's true that if the muscle cannot contract, the bone will not move. But that's not all that will happen.
This is not the best answer. Reflexes do require information to be transmitted on motor nerves, but what else do motor nerves do?

part.hint: The nervous system controls many things.

p.em: Which of the following functions are controlled by the autonomic nervous system?

multiple_choice.choice: [D] Control of your muscles of ventilation (for breathing).

response.feedback: Correct. This is the best choice. The autonomic nervous system controls the automatic functions of the internal organs. It is, therefore, also called the involuntary nervous system.
Not quite. This is correct, but there is also another correct answer.
Not quite. This is correct, but there is also another correct answer.
Incorrect. You consciously control your fingers.

Incorrect. This is a tricky one. We typically donâ€™t think about our breathing pattern, as it is controlled by some automatic (though not autonomic) nervous circuits. But we can override this automatic function if we decide to hold our breath, etc.

Incorrect. Movement of the fingers and, to some extent, breathing, are actions consciously controlled with skeletal muscles. The autonomic nervous system controls the involuntary actions of the internal organs.

part.hint: If the function is carried out by skeletal muscle, it is not autonomic.
